To proof.
[15]/10/78
M neglected to include the day in the date. The letter was registered at the Chief Secretary's Department on 16 October 1878.

I write a few lines, dear Mr Odgers, to ask whether you will kindly remind the hon. Graham Berry of my great wish for obtaining the £1800 for buildings, on the estimates before the parliamentary session closes, as otherwise a year will be lost.
See M to J. MacPherson, 16 April 1877, M to W. Odgers, 21 June 1877, and M to W. Odgers, 23 July 1878. A note on the file refers to the last of these.

You remember perhaps, that £900 lapsed two years ago. I am so very eager to get at last the Office-Museum and Laboratory Branches again in superior working order, and to provide space for the constantly increasing collections & working material. The present only room is so much out of repair, that it will be best to build anew in Albert-Park[.]
editorial addition.
I ask for no horticultural votes. Advise me kindly, whether I ought again to submit two official applications, one to the C.S., the other to the Minister of public works.
